results.title: Vision in mathematics: motion geometry
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and John Walker
results.brief_description: Reviews and illustrates three isometric plane transformations (translation, reflection, rotation). Examines some combinations of these operations and includes tables to show the final results.
results.description: Reviews and illustrates three isometric plane transformations (translation, reflection, rotation). Examines some combinations of these operations and includes tables to show the final results.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: more angles in a circle
results.brief_description: Explores the problem of placing a triangle of known angles so that it is circumscribed by a given circle. Indicates a method for locating one’s position on a map if three landmarks are recognised.
results.title_for_label: Vision in mathematics: more angles in a circle
results.description: Explores the problem of placing a triangle of known angles so that it is circumscribed by a given circle. Indicates a method for locating one’s position on a map if three landmarks are recognised.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: more about Pythagoras
results.brief_description: Develops some ideas arising from the theorum of Pythagoras, including the notion of irrational numbers. Uses the knowledge of Pythagoras’s theorem to calculate the length of a rafter in a roof.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: linear programming
results.creator_credit: John Walker, Australian Broadcasting Commission and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Examines ideas leading to consideration of linear programming, such as the values of various combinations of coins. Also shows the sequence of operations in preparing a linear program for the computer.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: isosceles triangles
results.brief_description: Discusses the properties peculiar to the isosceles triangle, to allow examination of many theorems involving bisectors, equality and congruence.

results.title: Vision at night
results.creator_credit: Science Films and Great Britain. Royal Air Force
results.brief_description: The structure of the eye, and its operation, especially at night: visual purple; rods and cones; scanning; adaptation; pre-adaptation; goggles; the value of special diet for night vision.

results.title: Visages de femmes = Faces of women
results.creator_credit: Films de la Lagune and Desire Ecare
results.brief_description: Twelve years in the making, “Visages de Femmes” is a wonderfully unpredictable and creative look at the financial, sexual and emotional emancipation of African women. The film is a series of episodes linked by a chorus featuring traditional singing and dancing. Ecare’s achievement is to create a visual feast which owes little to colonial models of cinema.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Films de la Lagune and Desire Ecare

results.title: Viruses: threshold of life
results.brief_description: With the aid of complex instruments such as the ultra-centrifuge and the electron microscope, the use of tissue cultures and animal experimentation, we see how scientists in a modern virology laboratory explore the nature of viruses, how these viruses exist and how we can use this knowledge to improve our health and well-being.
